name: The Profs
description:
The Profs is a web-based platform that connects students and tutors in any subject and level. Through us over 5000 students have taken classes in subjects as diverse as finance, medicine, coding and statistics.
Our work includes life-changing help for many students: Through private tuition we have helped hundreds of struggling students as well as students with Special Educational Needs pass their courses. Through educational consultancy we have supported top students further their life goals and career. Through university and job application advice we have mentored people into coveted institutions. We have also helped struggling professionals pass required qualifications and saved careers in the process. Our 5* score across 1000 reviews on independent review sites such as Trust Pilot and Google attest to our overall client and tutor satisfaction rates; people repeatedly cite our dedication, professionalism and commitment to education.

team.name: Leo Evans
team.bioHtml: PhD Finance from Imperial College, Seasoned Ed-Tech Entrepreneur: Founded The Profs, Founded BitPaper, Founded Spires, Founded Black and White Advisory

team.name: Richard Evans
team.bioHtml: Founder @The Profs. 1st class LSE. Worked London, Moscow, St Moritz. Grew Profs from bedroom to Belgravia in 18 months. The Guardian's Start Up 2016 Finalist

team.title: Business Analyst
team.name: Daniel Stillit
team.bioHtml: Five years in investment banking as well as leading three investment research teams at UBS: Special Situations/Event Driven, TMT and Valuation & Accounting.

jobs.title: Client Manager for Multi Award-Winning Education SME
jobs.description:
Who are The Profs?

The Profs is an award-winning (The Telegraph’s Best SME Exporter of the Year 2018) and innovative EdTech business providing higher education tutoring to clients and institutions around the world. In 2017 we were given our industry's top award (Education Investor, Best Tutoring Agency) and featured in the Startups 100. After years of growth, we are now looking to expand our team.


What’s the role?

You will be joining our Client Sales Team who manage new and existing customers. The role is a mixture of sales, client management, and administration with a big focus on selling our luxury service to clients. Throughout the year, we encourage our staff to take on new tasks in different areas of the business, be that marketing, accounts, operations or a new role that you define for yourself.


Duties

+ Liaising with several hundred students and pairing them with up to 400 tutors.

+ Taking new calls to identify and understand students' educational needs. (No outbound cold calls!).

+ Creating a shortlist of tutors for the client to choose from and matching them on our system.

+ Continued customer service and care to ensure customers are happy with our service.


Required Skills

+ Sales experience (up-selling and objection handling)

+ Excellent telephone manner with experience in telesales.

+ Experience of working in a fast-paced environment with weekly and monthly targets

+ Outstanding organisational skills and ability to manage a fast-moving pipeline with multiple leads at once.

+ High level of interpersonal skills, especially empathy and patience.


Preferred Skills

+ Experience of working in or knowledge of, the higher education sector.

+ A graduate degree of 2.1 or higher.

+ Critical thinker - Can you make things work smarter

The Profs are always looking to work with talented Graduates too and we would not expect the same level of skills or experience from candidates who have recently left university. 


What’s the office culture like?

The Profs are based in a beautiful WeWork office in Central London. Throughout the year we put on various events for our team to celebrate hitting targets, work anniversaries or birthdays. Each team members birthday is always celebrated with a birthday lunch, presents and Colin the Caterpillar (of course). Some of our more recent social events have been rooftop croquet at Skyline, Swingers Crazy Golf and Trampoline Dodgeball! In addition to this, our office comes with an in-house barista (free coffee), free beer (Meantime brewery) and has its own events team that organise weekly events for the whole building which range from lunch and learns and yoga classes, to in-house hairdressers and masseurs.
